Row.Text: This is a good place to found a city. Food and resources are plentiful here. To found the city, press your Settler's [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Found City[/COLOR] button in the unit's action panel on the left side of the screen
Found a City
Find Settler
You need to found a city - and soon! Click your Settler's [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Found City[/COLOR] button as soon as possible.
Found a City!
Find Settler
Consider sending your Warrior out to [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]explore new territory[/COLOR]. When a unit is selected, right-click on a tile to have that unit move there.
Explore the World
Find Warrior
You have a unit that hasn't moved for a while. Perhaps you should send it out to [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]explore the world[/COLOR].
Explore the World!
Find Idle Unit
Ancient Ruins hold secrets that may advance our civilization! [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Send a unit into an Ancient Ruin[/COLOR] to see what it holds.
Ancient Ruins!
Find Ruin

One of your military units is near an enemy unit. To attack, order a combat unit to move into a tile occupied by the enemy. In combat, both the attacking and defending units may take damage, and one might be destroyed.
Melee Combat
Find Combat Unit

We have no military units defending our territory. It's useful to have one or more military units in our territory to fend off roving barbarians and to discourage other civilizations from attempting sneak attacks.
Need Military to Defend!
The land near your city could be made more productive. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Build a Worker[/COLOR] to improve your territory.
Build a Worker!

Now that we have a Worker, we can order them to construct Improvements to boost the productivity of our territory. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Move your Worker to a highlighted tile and construct an improvement.[/COLOR]
Workers
Find Worker

Workers are defenseless, so use extreme caution when moving them outside our borders. Since we only have one city at the moment, we should [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]keep our Workers within our territory[/COLOR].
Keep Your Workers Safe!
Find Worker

We have a Worker, but have not improved any tiles yet. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Order your Worker to construct an improvement[/COLOR] on a tile near one of your cities to gain an economic benefit.
Worker Needs Work
Find Worker
I think we have enough Workers for the moment. You may want to build something else in your city.
Stop Making Workers

We have a unit that is on the verge of being destroyed. Wounded units are much less effective in combat and are easily killed, so consider moving it to a safe location and ordering it to [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortify Until Healed[/COLOR].
Heal Your Unit!
Find Damaged Unit
It is a dangerous world and we are vulnerable to attack. I suggest that you [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]build additional military units[/COLOR] to explore and to defend our civilization.
Need More Military

Your people are no longer happy. An [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]unhappy populace will not grow as fast as a content one. If you wish to make your citizens happier, [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]order your Workers to build Improvements on resources[/COLOR].
Your People are not Happy
Find Resource

Your people are very [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]unhappy. Our cities have drastically reduced [ICON_PRODUCTION]production and our units will not fight as well. Make your people happier by building happiness buildings, constructing improvements on resources, and trading for resources with other leaders.
Your People are Livid!
Our capital has grown into a bustling city! It may be time to [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]build a Settler[/COLOR] to found another city.
New City?
You have discovered a city-state! City-states are small countries that are not competing to win the game. You may interact with them diplomatically, or you may go to war with them.
City-States
Find City-State

A city-state has requested your assistance! If you provide help, you will gain Influence with the city-state. Once your Influence reaches a high enough level, the city-state will provide your civilization with various benefits.
A City-State Needs Help!
Find City-State

You can found a new city with your Settler. In order to grow, a city requires a number of quality [ICON_FOOD] food tiles nearby, so found your city next to [ICON_FOOD] food resources. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Move your Settler to a fertile location and found a new city.[/COLOR]
Where to Found a City
Find Settler

Your Settler is alone outside your borders and could be captured. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Order a military unit to escort your Settler[/COLOR] to protect them from barbarians and opportunistic enemy civilizations.
Guard your Settler
Find Settler
Cities, like military units, defend against attackers. A city can only be captured when its strength is reduced to zero. Use military units to defeat the besiegers before our city falls!
Besieged!
Find City
Our capital city has finished building a unit. Cities can build units, buildings, and wonders of the world, but only one at a time.
City Construction Complete
Only one military unit can occupy a tile at a time. During its turn a military unit can pass through other military units, but may not end its turn in an occupied space.
One Unit Per Tile
We have so many military units it is slowing our cities' [ICON_PRODUCTION]production. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stop building new military units[/COLOR] until our infrastructure can handle more.
Military Upkeep

You now have a ranged unit. Ranged units may attack enemies more than one tile away, but they are easily destroyed when attacked by melee units. Keep them safe behind your front line and they will serve you well.
Ranged Units
Find Ranged Unit

You can upgrade obsolete units, turning them into more powerful units by spending [ICON_GOLD]gold. To upgrade a unit, move it into your territory and the upgrade unit button will appear. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Press the upgrade button[/COLOR] to improve your obsolete unit.
Upgrading Units
Find Upgradable Unit

Thanks to your research, all of your future military units will possess the "Embark" promotion and can move across the water. To embark a land unit, simply order it to move into a water tile. Embarked units are defenseless, so consider escorting them with military vessels.
Embarking Units
Find Embarkable Unit

The enemy unit you are near is fortified. This means that it has a special defensive bonus (indicated by a shield flag). Fortified units are extremely difficult to defeat one-on-one, so consider attacking with multiple units in the same turn.
Fortified Units
Find Combat Unit

Cities can be tough to capture. Not only are their defenses strong, but they fight back, damaging or destroying your attacking units. Attack with multiple strong units on the same turn to capture enemy cities.
Besieging Cities
Find Combat Unit
Our treasury has grown and we have money to spend. You can use money to purchase tiles to expand your territory, purchase influence over City-States, upgrade your units, or bribe other civilizations.
Spend Some Gold
Cities can bombard nearby enemies and damage or kill them. [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Order your city to bombard the enemy troops![/COLOR]
City Bombard
Find City

You can use the right mouse button to direct your units' movement. With a unit selected, right click on a tile and the unit will move to that tile. If you hold down the right mouse button, you'll see which tiles the unit can move to in a single turn.
Right-Click Move

This is the city screen. It allows you to change what this city is building. On this screen you can also spend [ICON_GOLD]gold to purchase tiles around the city to expand your territory, and you can tell the city's citizens which tiles to work.
City Screen
Forests slow down unit movement. Moving into a tile with a forest will often consume all of a unit's movement points. Forests block the view of objects behind them.
Movement: Forests
Find Forest

Hills slow down unit movement, but provide a sight advantage by allowing the unit to see over trees and other hills. Moving into a tile with a hill will often consume all of a unit's movement points. Hills block the view of objects behind them.
Movement: Hills
Find Hill
Marshes slow down unit movement. Moving into a tile with a marsh will often consume all of a unit's movement points. Units have a difficult time defending when they are in a marsh, so be careful!
Movement: Marshes
Find Marsh
Land units cannot move through mountains; you must move around them. Mountains can be seen from quite a distance away.
Movement: Mountains
Find Mountain

Jungles slow down unit movement. Moving into a tile with a jungle will often consume all of a unit's movement points. Jungles block the view of objects behind them. Jungles are often quite hot and humid, but that doesn't matter.
Movement: Jungles
Find Jungle

Moving across rivers slows down unit movement. Moving across a river will often consume all of a unit's movement points. It is extremely difficult for units to fight well when attacking across a river, so position your units carefully.
Movement: Crossing Rivers
Find River
Having a strong Navy is the only way to defend and explore the oceans around our civilization. They can also wreak havoc among the enemy with their strong ranged attacks!
Naval Units
Find Naval Unit
Work boats allow you to improve fish and whale resources off your coast. Once you improve those locations, the work boats will be permanently converted.
Work Boats
Find Work Boat
Siege units are excellent at knocking out cities from range, but are defenseless if attacked by other units, so always defend them!
Siege Units
Find Siege Unit
Natural Wonders are hidden around the world. Discovering them makes your civilization happier. If you build a city adjacent to them, you get a significant benefit. Explore the world to find more!
Natural Wonders
Find Natural Wonder

While you can march military units in a city-state's territory, they certainly don't like it when you do. If you want to remain on good terms with a city-state, try to keep your military out of their borders.
Trespassing!
Find Trespasser
Barbarian camps are vile places that are to be eradicated as soon as possible! Barbarian camps spawn more barbarians, and the sooner you destroy them the less trouble they'll be.
Barbarian Camp
Find Barbarian Camp

Keeping your citizens happy is key to a productive civilization. Citizens produce [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] unhappiness, while luxury resources and some buildings provide [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] happiness to counteract it. Try to keep your civilization happy to keep it healthy!
Happiness

We have more than one of the same luxury resource improved. Our civilization receives [ICON_HAPPINESS_1]happiness for the first one but not for the others. We can trade the additional luxuries with other civilizations for their luxuries (or other resources) we don't have access to. Trade your excess luxuries with a friendly neighbor!
Trade Luxuries
If you wish to communicate with a civilization or city-state again, you may click on their city banner as a shortcut to talk with them.
Contact a Civ or City-State
Find City
Click on the diplomacy panel to learn more about our relationships with our neighbors. This provides us with all essential information regarding our diplomatic agreements and treaties.
Diplomacy Panel
All your units have orders and there is nothing else you can do this turn. Press the 'Next Turn' button to proceed to the next turn.
Click Next Turn
This a clever move! This attack will do a lot of damage to your opponent without your units taking much damage.
Smart Attack!
We may want to reconsider this attack; you will do marginal damage to your opponent and they will do considerable damage to you.
This Attack May Not End Well
This attack will damage both sides evenly. It's a good idea to continue this attack if you have multiple units nearby to wear them down before they can do the same to you!
Even Battle
Clever move! We crushed our opponents without taking much damage ourselves!
Smart Attack!
That battle didn't go our way. Perhaps with a little more planning we can reclaim our glory on the battlefield. Make sure to use the combat preview before attacking!
Not Our Finest Hour
That battle was a wash. We neither gained an advantage, or critically injured our opponent. You'll need to bring another unit in to support our troops.
Even Battle
Our treasury is depleted, and we need new sources of [ICON_GOLD]gold! Without [ICON_GOLD]gold, our research stagnates and we fall behind other civilizations.
Bankrupt!

The city we recently occupied is not yet excited about being part of our civilization and is causing a great amount of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]unhappiness. If we construct a courthouse in that city, the citizens will not be as [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]unhappy.
Occupied City Needs Courthouse
Find Occupied City

The city we recently occupied is causing a great amount of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]unhappiness. Building a Courthouse in that city will address their discontent, but we lack the research to do so. Research Mathematics so we can construct the Courthouse and they can be happy members of our civilization.
Occupied City is Unhappy
Find Occupied City

We have built up enough [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with a city-state to become friends! To see what bonuses we receive from this, click on the city-state. Our [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence will slowly decline over time, so continue to help the city-state or provide it with gifts of [ICON_GOLD] to maintain our friendship level.
Look Who Made a Friend!
Find Friendly City-State

Our unit is within an enemy's Zone of Control. This means that when you move from one tile next to an enemy unit or city to another tile next to that same enemy, it will consume all movement for that turn.
Zone of Control
Find Unit

Congratulations, a great person has emerged from your civilization! These brilliant individuals can do a number of things for you: start a golden age, construct a unique tile improvement on the map, or use their special power to great effect!
Great People
Find Great Person
There is more than one way to become the greatest civilization and win the game. In fact here are four routes: through military, technology, diplomacy, or culture!
How to Claim Victory!
Thanks to your military victories, a Great General has come forth! Great Generals can stack with military units and provide a huge benefit to ones nearby!
Great General
Find Great General

Cities are formidable targets that often require 4 or more units to capture. When you attack them in melee, the cities will damage your attacking unit. They also have a ranged bombard attack that will be used against any besiegers. Are you sure you want to proceed in the attack?
Attacking Cities

Settlers require 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] population to build, so to speed you on your way we gave your first city an extra [ICON_CITIZEN] population. Don't get used to it; cities founded from here on out will start with only 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] population.
Extra population
Find City
blah
City Screen

In the Production Chooser a unit, building, or wonder is selected to be produced in a city. A city can only work on a single item at a time. Every time your city completes a production, you'll be prompted again to have it build something new.
Production Chooser
The Tech Chooser allows you to select a technology that your civilization will research. When a technology has been discovered, you'll be prompted to select a new one to research.
Tech Chooser
The Tech Tree provides a birds-eye view of the technologies that may be discovered and how they are connected. Connections show the requirements needed to unlock new technologies.
Tech Tree
The Unit List shows all your units that you have under your command. You may select them to find where they are on the map and give them orders.
Unit List
The Military Overview provides an in-depth look at all the units in your civilization, as well as how much supply your units are consuming and progress toward earning a Great General.
Military Overview

The City List displays all the cities in your civilization. You can use this list to get a quick overview of what your civilization is currently doing and to easily change production if you go to war.
City List
The Economic Overview provides an in-depth look at all your cities. You can also investigate your [ICON_GOLD]gold income and what you're spending [ICON_GOLD]gold on.
Economic Overview
The Diplomacy List displays all the Civilizations and City-States that you've come in contact with and their score. Clicking on an entry will get you in contact with them.
Diplomacy List

The Diplomacy Overview is your gateway into all diplomatic information. You can see the diplomatic status between Civilizations, look at existing trade deals, and what resources are available for trade with other Civilizations.
Diplomacy Overview

The Diplomatic Trading screen allows civilizations to make diplomatic exchanges. Each side can build an offer from the list on their side, and then suggest it to the other side. Once both sides agree, the items in the trading screen are exchanged.
Diplomatic Trading

The Social Policy screen allows you to choose the Social Policies that will shape your civilization. You spend your accumulated [ICON_CULTURE]culture to unlock Social Policies. Some branches may not be selected until a technological era is reached. Also, some branches cannot be used together. (Look at the mouseover text to determine which ones are mutually exclusive.)
Social Policy
Tutorial
Learn as you play

New to Civilization? Not sure where to start? Afraid the villainous Barbarians will overrun your fledgling civ before you even get your feet wet? Let your Advisors guide you through the base concepts and stages of the game as you play! This overarching tutorial will cover all the important base aspects of the game, including a runthrough all the sections listed below.
Movement and Exploration
Tutorial 1
Movement and Exploration

Exploration is the act of searching or traveling a terrain (including space) for the purpose of discovery of resources or information. In human history, exploration of the physical world peaked during the Age of Discovery, spurred on by Europe's quest for contact with the rest of the world. In the more modern era, the pursuit of more advanced scientific concepts and information continues to drive exploration futher.
Founding Cities
Tutorial 2
Founding Cities

The heart of every civilization is found in its cities and the people who live there. Creating new cities to expand your empire's influence, wealth, and power is a core concept to grasp. Not all sites are suitable locations for new cities, and a poorly placed city can drastically slow expansion down.
Improving Cities
Tutorial 3
Improving Cities

Cities need to expand and grow to be productive members of a civilization, and improving them with Workers can help build their influence. Improving your cities not only helps keep them current with the rest of the world, but also improves how much they get from the land they are working. Through history, cities which fail to grow and develop with the nations around them are quickly left behind and made into easy targets for conquest.
Combat and Conquest
Tutorial 4
Combat and Conquest

There may come a time when someone wants your stuff, and doesn't want to talk about it. Combat, war, and conquests pepper the pages of human history, and civs unable to defend themselves from their foes won't often live to tell the tale. Even if you never find yourself on the offensive, understanding combat and how to wage effective war can save your civ from disaster.
Basic Diplomacy
Tutorial 5
Basic Diplomacy

Diplomacy, trade, alliances, and agreements are more polite ways of dealing with your neighbors, and effective diplomacy skills can often save you from a long and costly war. Some of the most effective leaders in history were masters of the art of Diplomacy; a well placed remark can often be more powerful and deadly than any number of swords.
I am your science advisor. In this lesson I'll teach you how to move your units around the map. In the process you'll discover ancient ruins, Natural Wonders, and whole new continents!
Movement and Exploration
I am your economic advisor. In this lesson I'll teach you how cities work, how to found new cities, and where the best places are to build them.
Building Settlers and Founding Cities

I am your economic advisor. In this lesson I'll teach you how to use Workers to enhance your cities. Under your command your Workers will build trade routes to collect [ICON_GOLD]gold, construct improvements to help your cities grow faster and build things quicker, and improve resources to make our people happier.
Using Workers to Improve Cities
I'm your military advisor and you can guess why I'm here. In this lesson I'll teach you how to stomp out barbarians and destroy their camps, and how to conquer an enemy civilization's city.
Combat and Conquering

I'm your foreign advisor. In this lesson you'll learn the basics of diplomacy with other civilizations and city-states. This is a complicated subject, so for now we will concentrate upon two important concepts: developing influence over a city state and trading resources with a neighboring civilization.
Basic Diplomacy
*GOALS*
Find all {1_Num} Ancient Ruins.
Explore all {1_Num} Ancient Ruins. ({2_Num} explored, {3_Num} remaining)
You Completed the Movement and Exploration tutorial! Nice job!
Found {1_Num} cities.
Found {1_Num} cities. ({2_Num} founded, {3_Num} remaining)
Found {1_Num} cities. Complete!
Discover {1_Num} Natural Wonders.
Discover {1_Num} Natural Wonders. ({2_Num} discovered, {3_Num} remaining)
Found {1_Num} Natural Wonders. Complete!
You Completed the Found Cities tutorial! Nice job!
Connect {1_Num} cities using roads to your capital.
Connect {1_Num} cities using roads to your capital. ({2_Num} connected, {3_Num} remaining)
Connect {1_Num} cities using roads to your capital. Complete!
Build improvements on {1_Num} resources.
Build improvements on {1_Num} resources. ({2_Num} resources improved, {3_Num} remaining)
Build improvements on {1_Num} resources. Complete!
Build {1_Num} farms that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] food.
Build {1_Num} farms that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] food. ({3_Num} farms that yield {2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] food constructed, {4_Num} remaining)
Build {1_Num} farms that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] food. Complete!
Build {1_Num} mines that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] production.
Build {1_Num} mines that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] production. ({3_Num} mines that yield {2_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] production constructed, {4_Num} remaining)
Build {1_Num} mines that yield at least {2_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] production. Complete!
You Completed the Improving Cities tutorial! Nice job!
Conquer enemy city.
Conquer enemy city. Complete!
Destroy {1_Num} barbarian camps.
Destroy {1_Num} barbarian camps. ({2_Num} have been destroyed, {3_Num} remaining)
Destroy {1_Num} barbarian camps. Complete!
You Completed the Combat and Conquest tutorial! Nice job!
Receive marble from a trade with a major civ.
Receive marble from a trade with a major civ. Complete!
Become allied with a City State by giving them [ICON_GOLD]gold and completing quests.
Become allied with a City State by giving them [ICON_GOLD]gold and completing quests. Complete!
You Completed the Basic Diplomacy tutorial! Nice job!
Unit List
Terrain and Feature List
Improvement List
Promotion List
Resource List
Specialists and Great People List
City-State List
Technology List
Building List
Wonder List
Social Policy List
Advisor Counsel
Next
Previous
Next
Previous
Next
Previous
Next
Previous
{1_Num}/{2_Num}
We haven't found any nearby rivals, so we should continue exploring to find other civilizations and city-states.
We need more military units to help defend our civilization.
We are nearly defenseless! We need to train more units!
We're at war! Build military units and buildings to achieve victory!
We're spending a lot on military maintenance. We should stop building more military units.
It's time for our barbarian neighbors to go extinct. Build military units and use them to destroy the camps.
We're winning! Keep the pressure on and claim victory!
We're losing! We should consider negotiating a peace treaty.
We should continue exploring the world to discover ancient ruins, natural wonders, and other civilizations!
We have enough explorers to discover the world. We should not start building any new land exploration units.
We need to continue exploring the seas to find new continents to settle.
We have explored enough coastal waters. We should not need to send more units to explore the seas.
We have room to expand, so let's train a settler and found a new city!
We should focus on growing and improving what we have rather than founding new cities right now.

Our people's [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] happiness is becoming a concern. We need to connect luxury resources, build [ICON_HAPPINESS_1]happiness buildings and wonders, and adopt policies that help make our civilization happy!
Our people are quite Unhappy! We need to connect luxury resources, build [ICON_HAPPINESS_1]happiness buildings and wonders, and adopt policies that help make our civilization happy quickly!
We have a lot of coastal cities so we should focus on buildings that improve yields from our coastal tiles.
We have water resources that we're not using. Build workboats and deploy them to help our civilization!
We have a settler, now find a good spot to found a city!
We are having a [ICON_FOOD]food crisis! Use Workers to build improvements that increase the amount of [ICON_FOOD]food that a plot provides.
We are having a [ICON_PRODUCTION]production crisis! Use Workers to build improvements that increase the amount of [ICON_PRODUCTION]production that a plot provides.
Avoid building harbors because we cannot use them without two coastal cities.
We have cities on the coast that can be connected using Harbors. Build harbors in those cities to provide trade routes across the water and collect more [ICON_GOLD]gold!

We need to increase our [ICON_GOLD]gold income to stay competitive. Disband obsolete units to lower our unit maintenance, use our workers to construct improvements that increase the amount of [ICON_GOLD]gold from a tile, and construct buildings that increase our [ICON_GOLD]gold income.
We're working on the Great Pyramid, so we needn't build granaries in our other cities.
Our [ICON_PRODUCTION]production is being diminished by the number of units that we have. We should disband any unneeded units so that our civilization can operate at full capacity.
Our homeland is a small continent without much room for expansion. We need to focus on naval technologies until we can embark units.
Your city of {1_CityName:textkey} is too small at this point to undertake large constructions like wonders. Focus on growing {1_CityName:textkey} to a larger size before taking on big projects.
{1_CityName:textkey} is landlocked, which means it doesn't have access to the water. So you have to worry more about bears than sharks.
{1_CityName:textkey} needs Workers to improve nearby tiles. We should train a Worker in {1_CityName:textkey} and have them improve the nearby tiles.
{1_CityName:textkey} would benefit greatly from having the surrounding tiles improved. Consider getting a Worker to help it out.
I don't think {1_CityName:textkey} needs to build any more Workers right now.
{1_CityName:textkey} has a considerable number of water tiles. We should focus on constructing buildings like the lighthouse that improve yield from those tiles.
{1_CityName:textkey} has unimproved resources in the water; we should get a work boat to improve the resource!
{1_CityName:textkey} has all of its naval resources improved.
{1_CityName:textkey} needs [ICON_FOOD]food to grow to be a larger city. Use your Workers to build farms nearby.
{1_CityName:textkey} needs [ICON_PRODUCTION]production to build things faster. Use your Workers to build mines nearby.
{1_CityName:textkey} has buildings that enhance our military production. We should build new units for our army in {1_CityName:textkey} to be most effective.
{1_CityName:textkey} is primed and ready to build a settler to expand our empire.
Keep watch around {1_CityName:textkey}, our capital city. Enemies have been seen in the area and we should be prepared for an attack.
Enemies have been trying to blockade {1_CityName:textkey}! Use ranged attacks by the city and nearby boats to drive off the enemy ships that may blockade you.
We should research {1_TechName:textkey} to unlock a unique {2_Adjective:textkey} civilization bonus!
We should research {1_TechName:textkey} so we can build a {@2_UnitName}, which is a unique unit for our {3_Adjective:textkey} civilization!
We should research {1_TechName:textkey} so we can build a {@2_BldgName}, which is a unique building for our {3_Adjective:textkey} civilization!
We should research {1_TechName:textkey} so we can build a {@2_BldgName}, which is a unique improvement for our {3_Adjective:textkey} civilization!
We should research {1_TechName:textkey} which allows us to improve the {2_ResourceName:textkey} within our borders.
I urge you to sue for peace immediately with the {1_LongCivName:textkey}; they threaten our very existence!
We would be wise not to provoke the {1_LongCivName:textkey}. They are immensely more powerful than us, so step softly and leave them be.
Our war with the {1_LongCivName:textkey} is not going well. We should consider offering peace to end the hostilities.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} has a much stronger military than us and it would be unwise to declare war at this point.
We are about as strong as the {1_LongCivName:textkey}; this war will test our mettle.
Our war with the {1_LongCivName:textkey} is going well and we have a stronger fighting force than them. Keep the pressure on and let us claim victory!
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is weaker than us militarily. If they have anything we'd like, now would be an appropriate time to ask.
With our numbers, we should be able to absolutely crush the {1_LongCivName:textkey}! Act fast before they can weasel out using some flimsy diplomatic ploy.
Our military is vastly more powerful than the {1_LongCivName:textkey}. I'm not suggesting that we should bully them, but we should exert our force purposefully to sustain our glorious realm!
Hmm, that's interesting. We have seen the {1_LongCivName:textkey} moving units near our borders.
We have seen a number of the {1_LongCivName:textkey} units around our borders. This may be a prelude to an attack.
This can't be good. The {1_LongCivName:textkey} has assembled a huge army on our borders! We should prepare ourselves for a sneak attack.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} has expanded closer to our territory.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} seem to be consuming much of the land near our cities. We may need to discuss this topic with them.
The land-grabbing {1_CivName:textkey} appears to be trying to suffocate our cities with their borders! We must take action about this or we will have no recourse but war!
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} seems to be quite peaceful with other civilizations. I'm sure they're up to something though!
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} has been aggressive with other civilizations. We should keep an eye on them.
I feel like the {1_LongCivName:textkey} are bullies and revel in kicking smaller civilizations and city-states around. My mother told me the best thing for a bully is a quick punch in the nose!
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is attacking everyone! Hide the women and children and protect our capital so they can't win a domination victory!
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is filled with blood lust! With their record of hostility toward all around them, it is only a matter of time before they attack us!
I'm not sure if the {1_LongCivName:textkey} has an army at all. Any hostilites with them would be laughably one-sided.
I think I saw the only unit the {1_LongCivName:textkey} had. It looked sad and lonely. It would be tragic for them if they got into a war with someone of our power.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} doesn't have as strong a military as us, but we shouldn't make fun of them too much during diplomatic meetings; they may feel insecure.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} military is around the same strength as ours.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is stronger than us militarily. We should not engage in combat with them without careful consideration and time spent growing and improving our military.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is not to be trifled with. They have a stronger military than us and we should only consider aggression in the most dire of circumstances.

The {1_LongCivName:textkey} wields an army that could wipe us off the planet. Do everything we can to remain at peace with them and build military as fast as possible to make our situation less perilous.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} has started competing with us for the alliance of {2_MinorCivName:textkey}.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is competing strongly to have an alliance with {2_MinorCivName:textkey}.
The {1_LongCivName:textkey} is aggressively undermining our relationship with {2_MinorCivName:textkey}!

We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is unit maintenance. Delete any units that are not absolutely necessary!

We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is unit supply, or paying for units outside our borders. Either move those units back into our borders or delete them; solving this financial problem is critical!
We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is building maintenance.

We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is improvement maintenance. We should not build more improvements than we need, and destroy any ones that are not helping us.

We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is diplomatic deals. We should not renew these deals if given a choice, or strike new deals that generate [ICON_GOLD]gold for us rather than losing it.

We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get our income positive so we have some hope of getting out of debt! Any cash that we could get from diplomatic means would certainly help out in the short-term.

We are bankrupt but are still making money. Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is unit maintenance, so delete any units that are not absolutely necessary so we can make it back into the black!

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't do something soon. We have worked to develop this relationship, it would be sad to lose an ally due to neglect.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They need help fighting against the {2_LongCivName:textkey}; if we declare war on that civlization we can keep our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to build a route from our capital to their city; if we do that we can keep our alliance.
We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to destroy a nearby barbarian camp; if we do that we can keep our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to connect {2_ResourceName:textkey}; if we do so we can get more influence to maintain our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to build the {@2_BldgName}; if we do so we can get more influence to maintain our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to get a {@2_UnitName}; if we do so we can get more influence to maintain our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. They want us to do their dirty work and defeat {2_MinorCivName:textkey}; doing so could aggrivate other parties, but it would sustain our alliance.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. If we want to maintain the alliance, we can explore and try to get in contact with the {2_LongCivName:textkey} to gain more influence.

We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. We can get some easy influence to maintain the relationship if we find a Natural Wonder, so let's get exploring!
We are going to lose our alliance with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we don't get some influence soon. If we want to maintain the alliance, try killing barbarians in or adjacent to their territory.
We are going to lose {1_MinorCivName:textkey} as a friend if we don't do something soon. If you think the relationship is worth maintaining, we should act to increase our influence over them.

We are going to lose {1_MinorCivName:textkey} as a friend if we don't do something soon. They need help fighting against the {2_LongCivName:textkey}; if we declare war on that civlization we can remain friends.

We are going to lose {1_MinorCivName:textkey} as a friend if we don't do something soon. If we want to maintain the friendship, we can explore and try to get in contact with the {2_LongCivName:textkey} to gain more influence.

We are going to lose {1_MinorCivName:textkey} as a friend if we don't do something soon. We can get some easy influence to maintain the relationship if we find a Natural Wonder, so let's get exploring!
We are going to lose {1_MinorCivName:textkey} as a friend if we don't get some influence soon. If we want to maintain the friendship, try killing barbarians in or adjacent to their territory.
We can gain influence over {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we gave them some money or a unit.
If we want to improve our relations with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}, they need help fighting against the {2_LongCivName:textkey}.
Using our Workers to build a route from our capital to {1_MinorCivName:textkey} would improve our relationship.
We can gain influence over {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we destroy a barbarian camp near them.
We can gain influence over {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we connect {2_ResourceName:textkey}.
We can gain influence over {1_MinorCivName:textkey} if we build the {@2_BldgName}.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} would be totally impressed if we got a {@2_UnitName}. We should do it!
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} wants us to wipe out {2_MinorCivName:textkey}! Why do they want that? Sounds cruel, but I'm sure it's for a perfectly valid reason.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} wants to be in contact with {2_CivName:textkey}. If we find them in our exploration it would provide some easy influence.
Discovering a Natural Wonder would get us influence with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
Killing barbarians in or adjacent to {1_MinorCivName:textkey} territory will provide us some influence over them.

{1_MinorCivName:textkey} has been captured by the {2_LongCivName:textkey}. If we were to capture the city and liberate it, we would restore the city-state of {3_MinorCivName:textkey} and we would get a tremendous amount of influence over them.
Our civilization is producing {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH]science with our {2_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN] population.

Our civilization is producing {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH]science with our {2_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN] population. We should focus on improving our research by building research buildings like libraries and universities.
Our civilization is producing {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH]science with our {2_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN] population. Now that's efficiency!
Our research is being crippled by our lack of [ICON_GOLD]gold. Without funds for research, we will fall hopelessly behind and will be but a quaint footnote in history.
If we research {1_TechName:textkey}, we'll be able to construct the {@2_BldgName} in our cities. We can push our research to new heights!
If we research {1_TechName:textkey}, we'll be able to construct the {@2_BldgName} and the {@3_BldgName} in our cities. We can push our research to new heights!
If we research {1_TechName:textkey}, we'll be able to construct the {@2_BldgName}, the {@3_BldgName}, and the {@4_BldgName} in our cities. That's a lot of research buildings!

{1_CityName:textkey} has grown to a large population and it lacks a {@2_BldgName}. If we build a {@3_BldgName} there, we will greatly increase our [ICON_RESEARCH]science output and make significant progress.
If we research {1_TechName:textkey}, we get access to the {@2_UnitName}. Having a modern military is key to safety and effective attacks.
If we research {1_TechName:textkey}, we get access to the {@2_BldgName}, which, when constructed, provides promotions to units built in that city.
We don't have any {1_ResourceName:textkey} and there is a source near {2_CityName:textkey}. Send a Worker out to improve that tile so we can get access to that resource.
There is a source of {1_ResourceName:textkey} near {2_CityName:textkey}. We already have this resource, but we could use any additional that we have in diplomatic trades.
We have additional {1_ResourceName:textkey} that we can use for trade and the {2_LongCivName:textkey} doesn't have any. We should try to strike a deal with them.

We have additional {1_ResourceName:textkey} that we can use for trade and the {2_LongCivName:textkey} doesn't have any. Carefully consider giving them this resource, because they can use it to train units that may eventually be used against us.
Please excuse me; I regret that I don't have much useful counsel at this time. Perhaps you should build more cities?
Build more units! Or not. I don't have much advice at this point. I may think of something if you ask later.
This well of wisdom is dry for the moment.
Consider what our enemies might be planning, but not too much. If you did that I wouldn't have a job!
I think it would help our civilization if we found a city since we currently don't have one.
Found a city so we can start building more military units!
Can we please found a city so I can put down my equipment somewhere? My arms are killing me.
To begin diplomatic relations, we should probably found a city so other civilizations will know where to find us if they want to talk.

I want to attack anyway
Let me reconsider
Thanks for the information, but don't remind me again.
Please don't tell me this again.
